A freelance TV worker says she was sent home early from a job because her manager told her, "You should be on a catwalk." Close Gretchen Carlson on Dealing with Sexual Harassment on the Job UP NEXT 
Emma Hulse, 24, arrived at UNIT TV in London only to be appraised for her looks and not much else. Emma Hulse says she was sent home for being too good-looking. Source: Instagram 
“I got there and spoke to the line manager and he asked me, ‘are you a model? Are you not doing catwalks, why are you not at the front of house?’" Emma told The Standard . Just five minutes into her work day, she was sent home. Source: Instagram 
"I was wearing a lipstick but from my perspective I was not inappropriate. I was wearing a shirt and trousers. I really didn’t think I looked inappropriate. 
"Then he took my number, he suggested we go for a drink." She was invited out for a drink by the same employee who then sent her home. Source: Instagram 
Five minutes into her eight-hour shift, Emma was dismissed. 
"I was quite disappointed to be sent home. I didn’t really know what to do," Emma said. 
"We were supposed to finish at 6pm and I got there for 9.30am and when I got there this other runner started explaining to me what I should do. 
"Then they send me on a run. Then my agent text me that I’m no longer required." 
She then speculated that the company may only employ unattractive workers. 
"Maybe that company employs plain looking people and maybe if you don’t look that way they don’t take you," she said. 
"Maybe I was a distraction." Emma believes her appearance worked against her. Source: Instagram Close Former 'Apprentice' contestant accuses Donald Trump of sexual harassment UP NEXT
